timeline.author: uarlouski

timeline.bodyText: If we walk through javadocs of JDK/Spring we can notice that the word after parameter name is always either article or noun, can we apply that common convention in vividus as well?
timeline.author: uarlouski
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -255,18 +173,18 @@ public void switchingToDefault() * * @see Frames * @see HTML Element Reference - * @param xpathExpression 'xpath' expression to locate frame element + * @param locator to locate frame element

replies.bodyText:
it's not something that can be controlled via tools, that should be mostly internal rules, but it's out of scope for this PR
@uarlouski will you create a ticket and describe the rules? after that all Javadocs could be refactored
replies.author: valfirst
ikalinin1

replies.bodyText:
we are talking here only about @param indentifier in java docs, all the mentioned project use @param followed by noun or article word. If just looking at some example from generated javadocs
Parameters:
name - to check for aliases
Parameters:
name - the bean name to check for aliases
Obviously the second case sounds more correct
replies.author: uarlouski

replies.bodyText: Per our discussion, fill the ticket and we will discuss Javadocs format changes
replies.author: ikalinin1

timeline.message: [plugin-web-app] Reset context before switching to a frame
[plugin-web-app] Introduce step to switch to a frame using locator
[plugin-web-app] Introduce step to switch to a frame using locator
